description: This course explores major aspects of language use that reflect Japanese culture and society.
Issues covered include the characteristics of the Japanese language, loan words, regional
differences, politeness, gender differences and communication styles. The course will be
taught in a combination of lectures, class discussions, subtitled Japanese films, anime
(Japanese animation) and student presentations. There are no prerequisites for 126; knowledge
of Japanese helpful but not necessary. Readings, lectures and discussions are all in English.
